concise_definition: adj. 受伤的, 受损害的; v. 伤害 (injure 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Suffering physical harm or damage to the body, typically as a result of an accident, violence, or illness; not in a healthy or functional state due to trauma.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因事故、暴力或疾病而遭受身体伤害或损害，处于不健康或功能受损的状态。
definitions.example_en: The injured player was carried off the field on a stretcher.
definitions.example_cn: 受伤的球员被担架抬下了球场。

definitions.explanation_en: Suffering harm or damage in a non-physical sense, such as reputation, feelings, or rights; emotionally or socially harmed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在非身体层面遭受损害，如名誉、情感或权利受损；情感上或社会性地受到伤害。
definitions.example_en: The scandal left his reputation seriously injured.
definitions.example_cn: 这起丑闻严重损害了他的声誉。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause physical harm or damage to someone or something, often unexpectedly or through force.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人或某物造成身体上的伤害或损害，通常是非预期的或通过外力造成的。
definitions.example_en: He injured his ankle during the basketball game.
definitions.example_cn: 他在打篮球时扭伤了脚踝。

definitions.explanation_en: To harm someone’s feelings, rights, or interests, often unintentionally or through neglect.
definitions.explanation_cn: 无意中或因疏忽而伤害他人的感情、权利或利益。
definitions.example_en: The policy injured the interests of small businesses.
definitions.example_cn: 这项政策损害了小企业的利益。

comparison.analysis: “Wounded” (负伤的) 通常特指因暴力、战争或武器造成的身体伤害，带有更强烈的军事或攻击性语境，如枪伤、刀伤。而 “injured” 适用范围更广，包括意外、运动、疾病等非暴力原因造成的伤害。
“Hurt” (疼痛/受伤) 是更口语化、更通用的词，可指身体疼痛或情感伤害，但缺乏 “injured” 那种正式或结构性的损伤含义。例如，说 “I hurt my back” 更口语，而 “I was injured in a fall” 更正式且强调事件后果。
“Damaged” (受损的) 主要用于物体、系统或抽象事物（如设备、声誉、关系），强调功能或完整性被破坏。而 “injured” 更常用于有生命体（人或动物）的身体或情感伤害，具有更强的生理或心理关联性。
